1.text: Wisdom has built a house for herself. She has hewn seven columns.

2.text: She has immolated her victims. She has mixed her wine and set forth her table.

3.text: She has sent her maids to call out to the tower and to the fortified walls of the city,

4.text: “If anyone is little, let him come to me.” And to the unwise, she has said:

5.text: “Approach. Eat my bread, and drink the wine that I have mixed for you.

6.text: Leave behind childishness. And live and walk by the ways of prudence.”

7.text: Whoever teaches a mocker causes injury to himself. And whoever argues with the impious produces a blemish on himself.

8.text: Do not be willing to argue with a mocker, lest he hate you. Dispute with the wise, and he will love you.

9.text: Present an opportunity to the wise, and wisdom shall be added to him. Teach the just, and he will hurry to receive it.

10.text: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom, and knowledge of holiness is prudence.

11.text: For by me, your days will be multiplied and years of life will be added to you.

12.text: If you would be wise, you will be so for yourself. But if you would be one who ridicules, you alone shall carry the evil.

13.text: A foolish and loud woman, who is full of enticements and who knows nothing at all,

14.text: sat at the entrance of her house on a seat, in a high place of the city,

15.text: so as to call to those who were passing by the way and continuing on their journey:

16.text: “Whoever is little, let him turn aside to me.” And to the frenzied, she said,

17.text: “Stolen waters are more soothing, and secret bread is more pleasant.”

18.text: And he did not know that giants are there, and that her companions are in the depths of Hell.
